snippet: Human rights groups say Abdul Rahman Haroun, incarcerated for nearly three months, is a scapegoat at a time when immigrants are not welcome in Britain.
abstract: Advocates for migrants point to prosecution of Abdul Rahman Haroun of Sudan by British authorities as example of how authorities are unjustly prosecuting migrants rather than treating them as refugees as required by international law; Haroun has spent almost three months in prison for walking about 30 miles through Channel Tunnel from France to Britain, feat that impressed many.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Human rights groups say Abdul Rahman Haroun, incarcerated for nearly three months, is a scapegoat at a time when immigrants are not welcome in Britain.

headline.print_headline: Prosecution of Migrant in Channel Tunnel Trek Draws Rights Criticism
headline.main: Channel Tunnel Migrant Emerges at Center of Asylum Debate
